refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns all or some keys from the given dictionary

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para:
The function returns an array of keys stored in the given dictionary, ignoring dependent parts of key-value pairs, but unlike dict_list_keys
it may return only some keys, not all, and it always remove the returned keys from the dictionary. The returned array is batch_size
items long (if the dictionary is big enough to fill it).

The order of items returned (and hence the content of the dictionary after function call) is undefined. It is not randomized artificially but it may vary from run to run depending on barely predictable factors. As a result, the most typical use of the function is calling it in a loop that ends when the size of returned array falls down to zero indicating that the dictionary is exausted.

refsect2.title: dict
refsect2.para: The dictionary where result keys come from.

refsect2.title: batch_size
refsect2.para: The maximum size of array to be constructed. The value can not be less than 65535 and more than the maximum allowed length of array (1250000 for 64-bit machines, 25000000 for 32-bit machines). All other equal, it is preferable to keep it below 200000.

refsect1.title: Return Types
refsect1.para:
The function always returns an array; the array is empty if dict
is NULL or an empty dictionary.

example.title: Simple Use
example.para: The function gets a dictionary with RDF triples stored as keys and inserts all these triples into a given graph.
